articles.title: Top injury-recovery tips from award-winning golfer turned Doctor of physical therapy
articles.description: I asked Dr. Eli Rogers to share his insight on the most effective pain-relieving methods and top tips to recover from injury. After experiencing injuries so many times himself, he changed paths from an award-winning golfer to a Doctor of Physical Therapy.
articles.content: For some people, stepping out onto the vibrant putting green is one of the best places to be. You can get away, swing that club, and maybe achieve a new personal best. An injury definitely takes the fun out of the game and puts a damper on your day. ... [10901 chars]

articles.title: Scientists think this is the first plant-eating land animal
articles.description: Tyrannoroter heberti fossil shows one of the earliest land animals to eat plants, changing what we know about how plant-eating began on land.
articles.content:
For tens of millions of years after animals first walked onto land, nearly all vertebrates were predators. Leaves, stems, and other plant foods were abundant, but early land animals largely ignored them.
So when did the first backboned animals begin ... [5731 chars]

articles.title: Wrinkled rocks were once home to ancient deep sea microbes
articles.description: Scientists discovered that wrinkled rocks in Morocco were formed by deep sea microbes that survived without sunlight.
articles.content:
A wrinkled slab of rock in Morocco is prompting scientists to rethink where ancient microbial life could survive.
Instead of forming only in shallow, sunlit seas, these unusual textures hint that rich microbial ecosystems may once have thrived deep u... [5190 chars]

articles.title: Only humans have true chins, and that may be an accident
articles.description: A new study explains why humans have chins while other primates do not. Researchers found that the chin likely formed as a side effect.
articles.content:
If you run a finger along the front of your jaw, you’ll feel a small bump just below your lower lip. It’s easy to overlook, but that tiny feature – the human chin – is something no other living primate has.
Chimpanzees, gorillas, and even our closest... [6139 chars]

articles.title: Lawsuit accusing journals of ‘conspiracy’ not to pay peer reviewers dismissed by court
articles.description: Judge Hector Gonzalez said the agreement was not binding, merely a set of guidelines, and was therefore not anti-competitive. A class action accusing scientific publishing giants of conspiring not to pay peer reviewers has been dismissed. The lawsuit by four US academics —
articles.content:
A class action accusing scientific publishing giants of conspiring not to pay peer reviewers has been dismissed.
The lawsuit by four US academics — neuroscientist Dr Lucina Uddin (PhD), a public health researcher, a geoscientist and a second neurosci... [542 chars]

articles.title: CSIRO - Australian innovation and space materials science
articles.description: CSIRO and industry are accelerating Australia’s space ambitions by advancing materials, optics and energy innovations.
articles.content:
CSIRO and industry are accelerating Australia’s space ambitions by turning advanced materials, optics and energy innovations into mission-ready technologies.
With Australian ingenuity firing across the space sector, CSIRO is working with industry par... [5537 chars]

articles.title: NASA hopes fuel leaks are fixed as it launches another countdown test for the Artemis II moonshot
articles.content:
CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla. (AP) — NASA began another practice launch countdown Tuesday for its first moonshot in decades with astronauts after making repairs to fix dangerous fuel leaks that already have bumped the flight into March.
The first fueling test... [1113 chars]

articles.title: A Pulsar Near The Milky Way's Galactic Center Is A Perfect Set-up To Test General Relativity
articles.description: The Milky Way's center is densely-packed with stars and there should be abundant pulsars there. But for some reason, we can't find them. New research presents a candidate pulsar in the GC. It's close enough to the Milky Way's supermassive black hole that it can test Einstein's General Relativity. But first, it has to be confirmed.
articles.content:
The Milky Way's galactic center should be home to many pulsars, but for some reason, we can't find them. New research identified a candidate pulsar very near the MW's center. If it can be confirmed, it's a chance to test General Relativity.
The tenta... [5921 chars]

articles.title: Tiny RNA Molecules in Sperm, Big Impact on Baby Health
articles.description: Mounting evidence from research on nematodes to mice indicate that a father’s environment, such as what he eats or if he is exposed to stress or toxicants, can lead to metabolic and behavioral disorders in his offspring.
articles.content:
Key takeaways
The study pinpoints a specific sperm-enriched RNA that is actively packaged during sperm maturation and delivered to the embryo at fertilization, where it helps regulate early gene activity critical for cell division and genome organiza... [6310 chars]

articles.title: Family Relationships Identified In Stone Age Graves On Gotland
articles.description: A woman was buried with two children, but they were not her own. In another grave, two children were placed. They were not siblings and were more
articles.content: A woman was buried with two children, but they were not her own. In another grave, two children were placed. They were not siblings and were more distantly related, perhaps cousins. In a new study, researchers at Uppsala University have clarified fam... [4139 chars]
